error.msg: The scope of the variable 'cosCurr' can be reduced.
error.verbose: The scope of the variable 'cosCurr' can be reduced. Warning: Be careful when fixing this message, especially when there are inner loops. Here is an example where cppcheck will write that the scope for 'i' can be reduced:\012void f(int x)\012{\012 int i = 0;\012 if (x) {\012 // it's safe to move 'int i = 0;' here\012 for (int n = 0; n < 10; ++n) {\012 // it is possible but not safe to move 'int i = 0;' here\012 do_something(&i);\012 }\012 }\012}\012When you see this message it is always safe to reduce the variable scope 1 level.

error.msg: Variable 'eType' is assigned in constructor body. Consider performing initialization in initialization list.
error.verbose: When an object of a class is created, the constructors of all member variables are called consecutively in the order the variables are declared, even if you don't explicitly write them to the initialization list. You could avoid assigning 'eType' a value by passing the value to the constructor in the initialization list.
